title: Up in the Rockies: Comparing Z-Scores
question_text: The $50$ highest mountain peaks in Colorado have an average height of $13,891.1$ feet.  Mount Elbert is the tallest at $14,440$ feet.  Standardized z-scores for four of the other mountains (of the $50$ highest) are given below.  List these mountains in order from tallest to shortest. Henry Mountain: $z = -1.64$ Mount Massive: $z = 1.40$ Mount Powell: $z = -0.80$ Pike's Peak: $z = 0.58$

choices.text: Henry Mountain, Mount Massive, Mount Powell, Pike's Peak
Pike's Peak, Mount Powell, Mount Massive, Henry Mountain
Mount Massive, Pike's Peak, Mount Powell, Henry Mountain
Henry Mountain, Mount Powell, Pike's Peak, Mount Massive
Pike's Peak, Mount Massive, Henry Mountain, Mount Powell
